AudioContextSetSinkId.summary: The setSinkId() method of the interface sets the output audio device for the AudioContext. If a sink ID is not explicitly set, the default system audio output device will be used.

remarks.para: To set the audio device to a device different than the default one, the developer needs permission to access to audio devices. If required, the user can be prompted to grant the required permission via a call.
In addition, this feature may be blocked by a speaker-selection Permissions Policy.

-SetSinkId test example
-Change the destination output device in Web Audio
-
-

AudioContextSetSinkId.returns: A that fulfills with a value of undefined.Attempting to set the sink ID to its existing value (i.e. returned by ), throws no errors, but it aborts the process immediately.
